ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours
1 hour
On weeks that we had a presenter, I spent 3 hour outside of class working on the course.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: -Great speakers who knew a lot about their respective topics -Great examples of real life applications of modeling Weakness: -Not as great to take as a first year because some of the modeling techniques have not been taught to us yet

It was great to get more exposure to modeling concepts and applications. The only weakness is the lack of opportunity to discuss the topics in an informal setting. The student journal club was usually not helpful and sometimes didn't even happen at all.

Some great guests, would've loved to see some more variety in subject matter. Heavy on epidemiology. There are plenty of people modeling in other areas and disciplines of public health that would would be happy to come speak- HEOR, healthcare operations, interventions for developing countries, UN, WHO, hospital systems, payers, PBMs.
There were a lot of good lectures this semester.
Learned a lot of methods related to modeling
N/A
Average. Can be improved by requiring small group discussion of the papers before the speakers come.

Strengths: informative speakers at the top of their field Weakness: no speakers on policy modeling or social network modeling. Both are recognized as important by YSPH through the Health Policy department or SBS department.
it is good.
Interesting speakers!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is responsible for inviting some lecturer to give speech to us and the reports were pretty fancy. We learned some modeling applications in epidemiology.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  great
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  N/A
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is nice and patient, the course is well-organized.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good but sometimes slow to respond via email
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  He is well-known and responsible.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  great
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  N/A
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  Very helpful in my application questions for the modeling concentration.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  She is nice and patient, the course is well-organized.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  Wonderful

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Interesting but too heavily catered towards epidemiologists. Very few guests come to talk about healthcare or modeling in other areas of public health.
It is required course for modeling concentration, if you want to enroll in the modeling concentration, you have to select this seminar.
Attend if interested in learning more about modeling. Some great speakers are brought in for these seminars.
N/A
No, would not recommend. But it is required for the modeling concentration.
A great course to see if you are truly interested in modeling before taking harder upper division courses in the subject.
Good and useful.
Take it! You will learn lots and discover how modeling can inform many different types of issues
